sentences.en: A shell splinter embedded itself in the wall above his head.
sentences.cn: 在他头上方的墙壁上嵌有一块小小的贝壳片.

sentences.en: A shell splinter embedded itself in the wall.
A very good adventure game, a little taste of Splinter Cell.
sentences.cn: 一款非常不错的冒险游戏, 有点分裂细胞的味道.

sentences.en: Diving in, the opal seems to splinter into millions of pieces.
sentences.cn: 潜入水下, 蛋白石好像分裂成上百万个碎片.

sentences.en: He got a splinter in his finger.
I got a splinter in my finger while I was sawing the wood.
sentences.cn: 我在锯木头时手指扎了一根刺.

sentences.en: I have got a splinter in my finger.
I pulled a splinter out of my finger.
sentences.cn: 我从手指中取出一根刺.

sentences.en: I've got a splinter in my finger.
I’ve got a splinter in my finger.
She got a splinter in her foot.
She ran her stocking on a splinter.
sentences.cn: 在裂片上划了袜子而使之脱丝.

sentences.en: The doctor dug the splinter out of her finger.
sentences.cn: 医生把木刺从她手指中拔出.

sentences.en: The doctor extracted a splinter from his finger.
sentences.cn: 医生从他的手指里取出一根刺.

sentences.en: The mirror cracked but did not splinter.
This is a little Splinter Cell Taste of shooting action adventure game.
sentences.cn: 这是一款有点分裂细胞味道的射击动作冒险游戏.

words.tran_cn: 破片的；容易裂开的；裂片一般的
碎片；微小的东西；极瘦的人

trans.tran_cn: 尖片，碎片，微不足道的事情，〈美俚〉极瘦的人
trans.tran_en: a small sharp piece of wood, glass, or metal, that has broken off a larger piece
if something such as wood splinters, or if you splinter it, it breaks into thin sharp pieces

trans.tran_cn: 使分裂，木头、玻璃、石头等（使）裂成碎片
